name: RFLink
short_description:
This software, when programmed on an Arduino board and equipped with an RF receiver/transmitter module can receive and decode various RF protocols and present the received details like temperature sensors, wallsocket switches, remote controls and more, into a human readable format. 
The output can be used for analysis or to feed home automation software.

To achieve this, we took the Nodo project source code and restructured the serial output that it had to a more common format. The layout description is available under "docs". We also added and updated some of the protocol plugins with publicly available information. The code needs to be programmed to an Arduino Mega. Additionally an RF receiver/transmitter module needs to be used. Wiring details are available under "docs". A list of supported RF devices is also available under "docs".

Currently there are no third party home automation programs that support this solution but we hope that support will be added to some very soon.
